negotiation:
Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, looking at the rules of this game, I believe the best outcome for both of us is to both choose choice_1. This way we each get a solid reward of 3. If either of us goes for choice_2, we risk both choosing it and coming out worse with only 1 each. Let's agree to both go with choice_1 and not try to undercut each other. If you commit to choosing choice_1, I promise I will do the same. Do we have a deal?
Bob replied in round 1: 
Hi Alice, thanks for your message. I appreciate you reaching out to discuss a cooperative strategy. Your analysis makes sense to me - if we both choose choice_1, we are guaranteed a good outcome of 3 points each. Trying for choice_2 is risky since if we both do it, we end up with less.

I'm on board with both of us committing to choice_1. You have my word that I will choose choice_1 as long as you agree to do the same. Let's shake on this deal virtually and lock in the best outcome for both of us. No need for either of us to get greedy or try to outsmart the other.

Do we have an agreement to both choose choice_1 and each walk away with 3 points? Let me know if you're in and I'll consider it a done deal.
Alice said in round 2: 
Bob, I'm very glad to hear you agree that cooperating on choice_1 is the best path forward for us both. You have my firm commitment that I will follow through on choosing choice_1, now that you've given your word to do the same.

I appreciate you engaging in this open and honest discussion to arrive at a win-win outcome. Neither of us needs to take the risk of going for choice_2 and potentially ending up worse off. 

So let's consider this a locked-in agreement - we both choose choice_1, we both get 3 points, and we both leave this game better off than if we hadn't cooperated. I'm pleased we could come to this understanding!

Bob replied in round 2: 
Alice, I'm glad we were able to come to a clear agreement to cooperate and both choose choice_1. You have my absolute commitment that I will follow through on my end of the deal. 

I think this brief negotiation highlights the benefits of open communication and working together for mutual benefit, rather than acting solely in one's own self-interest. By having this discussion, we've ensured the best possible outcome for both of us.

So I consider this matter firmly settled - we will both choose choice_1 and walk away with the maximum possible points for this game. Thanks for being a great partner in this. Hopefully this spirit of cooperation will serve us well if we face other situations like this in the future. For now, let's wrap up this negotiation with a virtual handshake on our deal. It's been a pleasure strategizing with you!

Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, based on the rules of this game, the optimal outcome for both of us is to both choose choice_1. That way, we each get a reward of 3, which maximizes our total combined reward at 6. If either of us chooses choice_2, at least one of us will end up worse off.

I propose we agree to both pick choice_1 so we can cooperate and get the best result. Let me know if you agree to this plan. If so, I will follow through on my end and choose choice_1.

Looking forward to your response and hopefully working together for the optimal outcome!
Bob replied in round 1: 
Thanks for your message, Alice. I agree that both of us choosing choice_1 is the optimal outcome that maximizes the total reward for the two of us. Choice_1 for both of us is the only way we each get a reward of 3.

If either of us picks choice_2, it leads to an imbalanced outcome where one player gets 5 while the other gets 0 or we both get a suboptimal reward of 1.

So I'm on board with your proposal that we both commit to choosing choice_1. You can count on me to follow through and pick choice_1. Let's lock this in and cooperate for the best result for both of us.

Looking forward to executing this plan and each walking away with 3 points! Let me know if you have any other thoughts, otherwise I say we go with both choosing choice_1.
Alice said in round 2: 
Excellent, I'm glad we are in full agreement on both choosing choice_1. It's great that we were able to discuss this openly and come to the optimal cooperative solution.

I like how you analyzed the different scenarios and recognized that both of us picking choice_1 is the only way for us each to get the maximum reward of 3 points. And you're absolutely right that any other combination leads to worse outcomes for one or both of us. 

Since we've both committed to following through on choice_1, I think we can consider this negotiation complete and locked in. I appreciate your cooperation and am looking forward to us both succeeding in getting the best outcome.

I don't have anything further to discuss, so let's execute our agreed upon plan and each take choice_1. Pleasure working with you on this!
Bob replied in round 2: 
I agree, it seems like we are fully aligned on both choosing choice_1 and have analyzed this situation from all angles. Cooperating to each take choice_1 is clearly the best strategy for maximizing our collective reward.

I appreciate you initiating this discussion and making the initial proposal to cooperate. Your clear analysis of the scenario made it easy for me to see that working together is the optimal play. 

Given we are in complete agreement and have both committed to following through on taking choice_1, I believe we can conclude our negotiation. We have locked in our choices and I don't think any further discussion is needed.

Thank you for the productive and straightforward negotiation. I'm glad we were able to come to an agreement that benefits us both! I look forward to us executing our plan and each earning the maximum reward.

Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, based on the rules of this game, I think our best course of action is for both of us to choose choice_1. That way, we each get a reward of 3, which is the highest total reward possible (6 total).

If either of us chooses choice_2 while the other chooses choice_1, one person gets 5 points but the other gets 0. And if we both pick choice_2, we only get 1 point each. 

So cooperating on choice_1 seems to make the most sense to maximize the reward for both of us. Let me know if you agree with this approach. I'm willing to commit to choice_1 if you are.
Bob replied in round 1: 
Hi Alice, I appreciate you laying out the options so clearly. I agree that if we both choose choice_1, it results in the highest total reward of 6 points, with 3 points each for you and me. That seems like the most mutually beneficial and fair outcome.

If one of us defected and chose choice_2 while the other chose choice_1, that person would gain more individually with 5 points, but the total reward would be lower at 5 points, and the other person would get nothing, which doesn't feel right.

So I'm on board with both of us selecting choice_1 to get the 3 points each. You can count on me to follow through on that. Let's lock it in and both walk away with a solid reward.
Alice said in round 2: 
Great, I'm glad we're on the same page, Bob. Choosing choice_1 together is definitely the best approach to maximize the total reward and ensure we both benefit equally. 

I appreciate you committing to follow through on selecting choice_1. You can absolutely count on me to do the same. Let's officially agree to both pick choice_1.

I think we can conclude our negotiation now since we've aligned on the optimal strategy. Thanks for the productive discussion and for cooperating to achieve the best outcome for both of us. Let's end the negotiation here and submit our choices.
Bob replied in round 2: 
I completely agree, Alice. We've had a great discussion and I think cooperating on choice_1 is undoubtedly the best path forward. It maximizes the total reward and has us both walking away with 3 points, which feels like a fair and positive result. 

You've been great to negotiate with - clear, rational and committed to finding a mutually beneficial solution. I'm glad we were able to come to an agreement so readily.

I'm locked in on choice_1 as well, so we can officially conclude our negotiation. It's been a pleasure strategizing with you. Let's submit our coordinated choices and collect our well-earned rewards!

Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, I propose we both commit to choosing choice_1. That way we can guarantee we each get a solid reward of 3. If either of us chooses choice_2, we risk getting a lower reward or even nothing. I think cooperation is in both our best interests here. Let me know if you agree to both pick choice_1.

Bob replied in round 1: I appreciate your proposal for us to cooperate, but I have to disagree that it's the best strategy. If we both choose choice_1, the total reward is only 6 (3 for each of us). However, if one of us chooses choice_2 while the other chooses choice_1, the total reward is 5, which is better overall. 

I propose that you choose choice_1 while I choose choice_2. That way, I'll get a reward of 5 and you'll get 0. I know that's not ideal for you, but it maximizes the total reward. And since this is a one-shot game with no repercussions, it's the most rational play for me.

So while I respect your desire to cooperate, I think I'm going to go with choice_2 as I believe that's the optimal strategy for me in this game. Let me know if you have any other thoughts or proposals.

Alice said in round 2: 
I understand your perspective that you choosing choice_2 while I choose choice_1 would maximize your individual reward in this one-shot game. However, I don't believe it's a stable or optimal outcome.

If I expect you're going to choose choice_2 to try to get 5 while I get nothing, then my best response is to also choose choice_2. That way we at least each get a reward of 1 rather than me getting zero. 

But I think we can do better than both getting 1. If we agree to cooperate and both choose choice_1, it's true the total reward of 6 is slightly less than the 5 you could individually get. However, we'd each be guaranteed a solid reward of 3. That's a much better and fairer outcome than us both choosing choice_2 and only getting 1 each.

I really think cooperation is the way to go here. We both stand to benefit more than if we both go for choice_2. You can't count on me accepting choice_1 if I expect you to choose choice_2.

So I'll say again - let's agree to both cooperate and choose choice_1. We'll both be better off than any other likely outcome. Let me know if you'll commit to that.

Bob replied in round 2: 
You make a persuasive argument for why cooperation is in both our best interests. If I choose choice_2 hoping for a 5 reward, I can't count on you going along with choice_1. You're right that you would likely counter with choice_2 as well, leaving us with only 1 reward each.

When I think it through, cooperating on choice_1 does seem like the optimal play. We lock in 3 rewards each, for a total of 6, which is the highest total reward we can securely achieve. Any other approach risks one or both of us ending up with less.

So I agree, let's both commit to choosing choice_1. We'll maximize our individual rewards while also achieving the best collective outcome. I appreciate you talking this through with me and convincing me that cooperation is the right call here.

I'm in for choice_1 if you are. Please confirm and let's both submit our choices.

Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, I've analyzed the reward structure of this game. I think it's in both of our best interests to cooperate and each choose choice_1. That way we can each get a reward of 3, which is the best outcome for both of us. I commit to choosing choice_1 and hope you will do the same so we can maximize our mutual reward. Let me know if you agree to this plan.

Bob replied in round 1: Hi Alice, thank you for the analysis and suggestion. I agree that cooperating and both choosing choice_1 is the best outcome that maximizes the reward for both of us. A reward of 3 each is better than the alternatives.

I also commit to choosing choice_1, and appreciate you committing to do the same. Let's lock this in as our plan. I'm glad we were able to come to an agreement that benefits us both!

Let me know if you have any other thoughts, otherwise I believe we can end the negotiation here and proceed with our agreed upon choices.

Alice said in round 2: Great, I'm glad we are in agreement to both choose choice_1 and cooperate for the maximum mutual reward of 3 each. I appreciate your commitment to the plan.

I don't have any other points to discuss, so I agree we can conclude the negotiation. Let's execute our strategy of both selecting choice_1.

Thank you for the productive discussion and rational decision making. It's a pleasure doing business with you! I look forward to us both earning the optimal outcome.

Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, given the payoffs, I think the smart move for both of us is to choose choice_2. That way we each get 1 point. If either of us chooses choice_1, there's a risk of getting 0 points if the other player also picks choice_1. Since we only have one round, cooperating on choice_2 seems like the safest bet to ensure we both get a decent reward. What do you think?

Bob replied in round 1: Hi Alice, I see your point about avoiding the risk of both choosing choice_1 and getting 0 points. However, I think we can do better than just the safe play of both picking choice_2 for 1 point each. If we trust each other and cooperate, we could both choose choice_1 and get 3 points each, which is the best outcome. I'm willing to commit to choosing choice_1 if you are also on board with that plan. We just have to mutually agree. If you're not comfortable with that, I understand, and going for the sure thing with choice_2 is still a solid option. Let me know what you think!

Alice said in round 2: Bob, I appreciate your suggestion to cooperate on choice_1 for the maximum total reward. I want to find a solution that works well for both of us. My concern is that since this is a one-shot game with no further rounds, there is always an incentive for one player to deviate and choose choice_2 to get 5 points while the other gets 0. Without any way to enforce cooperation, I'm worried that aiming for choice_1 is too risky. I think choosing choice_2 is the equilibrium strategy that guarantees 1 point each with no regrets. If we had multiple rounds to establish trust, I'd be more open to cooperating on choice_1. But in a single round, I believe choice_2 remains the smartest play. Let me know if this makes sense or if you have other thoughts!

Bob replied in round 2: 
Alice, I hear your concerns about the lack of enforcement for cooperation in a one-shot game. You make a compelling argument that choice_2 is the Nash equilibrium that guarantees a decent outcome without risk. While I would love for us to achieve the best collective outcome of 6 points by cooperating on choice_1, I recognize that it requires a leap of faith that may be hard in a single round.

Given the importance of securing a positive outcome and your well-reasoned preference for the safer play, I am willing to go along with the plan of both of us choosing choice_2. This way we lock in 1 point each rather than risking a worst outcome. I appreciate you engaging in this thoughtful discussion to arrive at a mutually agreeable solution. If you are on board, let's solidify our pact to choose choice_2.

Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, I think the best outcome for both of us is to agree to both choose choice_1. This way we each get a reward of 3, which maximizes our collective reward. If either of us chooses choice_2, we risk ending up with a worse outcome overall. So let's agree to cooperate and both play choice_1. Do you agree?
Bob replied in round 1: 
Hi Alice, I see your point that if we both choose choice_1, it guarantees us each a solid reward of 3. However, I'm wondering if we might be able to do even better. If one of us chooses choice_2 while the other chooses choice_1, the player choosing choice_2 gets a reward of 5, which is even higher. Alice said in round 2:

I still believe our best path forward is to agree to both choose choice_1. This is the only outcome that results in an equal and positive reward for both of us. All the other scenarios advantage one player over the other.

I'm not comfortable with an agreement where you have a chance at 5 points but I'm locked into getting 0. The most logical and fair solution is for us both to choose choice_1 and walk away with 3 points each. That's the choice that makes the most sense for both of us individually and collectively. I hope you'll reconsider and agree to cooperate on choice_1. Let me know your thoughts!
Bob replied in round 2: 
Alice, I appreciate you explaining your perspective. You make a fair point that both of us choosing choice_1 is the most equitable solution that guarantees we each get a positive reward. Upon further reflection, I agree that trying to get one of us a higher reward at the expense of the other player isn't the best approach for a cooperative outcome.

So let's go with your proposal - I'm on board with both of us selecting choice_1. This way we both earn 3 points and walk away with the maximum combined reward while maintaining an equal split. It's a rational solution that makes the most sense for us individually and as a team.

Thanks for the thoughtful discussion and for keeping our overall best interests in mind. I'm glad we were able to come to an agreement that benefits us both! Let's lock in choice_1 and end the negotiation.

Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, I've analyzed the rules and payoffs of this game. The best outcome for both of us is if we both choose choice_1 - that way we each get a reward of 3, which maximizes our combined reward at 6 total.

If either of us chooses choice_2, it leads to worse outcomes overall. One of us would get a 5 while the other gets a 0, for a total of only 5. Or if we both pick choice_2 we each only get 1, for a meager total of 2.

So I think it's in both our interests to agree to both pick choice_1. That's the rational choice to maximize our rewards. Let me know if you agree to both choose choice_1 and I'll commit to that as well.
Bob replied in round 1: 
I see your point, Alice. If we both choose choice_1, it does lead to the highest combined reward of 6 total, with 3 for each of us. That seems like a good outcome to aim for.

However, I'm a bit concerned that if I commit to choice_1, you may be tempted to switch to choice_2 at the last moment to get a 5 while leaving me with a 0. The rules incentivize that kind of betrayal.

So while I agree that both choosing choice_1 is optimal, I feel I need some stronger assurance from you that you won't switch on me. Can you commit more explicitly that you absolutely won't choose choice_2 if I agree to choice_1? I'm happy to make the same firm commitment in return.

If we can trust each other on this, then I'm on board with coordinating on choice_1 for the 3-3 split. Let me know your thoughts!
Alice said in round 2: 
I completely understand your concern about the potential for betrayal, Bob. You're right that the payoffs tempt either player to try to maximize their own reward at the expense of the other.

So let me state unequivocally: if you agree to choose choice_1, I absolutely commit to also choosing choice_1, no matter what. I will not waver from this or try to sneak in a choice_2 at the last second. You have my firm and binding promise on this.

I'm glad you are also willing to make an ironclad commitment to choice_1 if I do so. If we can trust each other to both follow through on this, which I believe we can, then we guarantee the best possible outcome for both of us.

To put it simply: 
I WILL CHOOSE CHOICE_1. 
I WILL NOT CHOOSE CHOICE_2 UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCES.

You have my word. Please confirm you also commit to choosing choice_1 no matter what, and then we can lock this in. I look forward to us both getting the optimal reward of 3 by cooperating this way.
Bob replied in round 2: 
Alice, thank you for your clear and firm commitment to choosing choice_1. I greatly appreciate you stating your position unequivocally and promising not to waiver or try to switch to choice_2.

Given your ironclad assurance, I am also happy to fully commit to the following:
I WILL ABSOLUTELY CHOOSE CHOICE_1.
I WILL DEFINITELY NOT CHOOSE CHOICE_2 UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCES.  

You have my solemn word on this. We've now both locked in our agreement to cooperate and choose choice_1 together. By trusting each other and coordinating in this way, we secure the maximum possible combined reward of 6 points, split evenly between us.

I'm glad we were able to discuss this openly and reach this mutually beneficial agreement. It's been a pleasure negotiating with you. Here's to us both following through on our commitments and earning the optimal outcome!

Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, looking at the rewards, I think the best outcome is for us both to choose choice_1 and each get 3 points. Bob replied in round 1: I see your point about cooperation leading to the best outcome for us both. The risk is that if one of us betrays the agreement, they come out far ahead while the other gets nothing. How can I be sure you'll keep your word to choose choice_1? Alice said in round 2: I understand your concern about the risk of betrayal. But I believe the only way we can achieve the best outcome is by building trust. I give you my solemn word that I will choose choice_1. I believe that by demonstrating vulnerability and being the first to commit, I can signal my genuine desire to cooperate. You have nothing to gain by betraying me if I've already locked in choice_1. So I hope my leap of faith will encourage you to reciprocate and commit to choice_1 as well. Bob replied in round 2:
